private_information: I am the human player controlling high-level choices.
I can choose which action to attempt on which objects from the available action set.
player.goal: Produce a feasible high-level plan sequence that achieves the goal next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_8.

private_information: I can convert action descriptions into a formal state-transition model and validate reachability under deterministic rules.
I maintain an internal representation of objects and predicates and can simulate precondition and effect application.
simulator.goal: Provide an accurate, explicit action-schema model and state-update rules for all actions described in the environment.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency, and I remove modelling shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, and implicit bookkeeping.
I flag ambiguous or conflicting predicate usages and ensure uniform naming and causal chains.
auditor.goal: Audit the proposed model and plan for temporal/causal consistency, eliminate bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a clean, explicit report of corrections.

private_information: I integrate analyses from other agents and produce the final formal PDDL domain and problem files suitable for the FastDownwards planner.
I keep agent actions distinct when merging representations.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from other agents and emit a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Objects are named object_0 through object_12 (indices observed up to 12).
Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted, each parameterized over objects as described in the specification.

Action paltry parameters: object_0 object_1 object_2. Preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.

Action sip parameters: object_0 object_1 object_2. Preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Effects add: vase object_0 object_1. Effects delete: next object_0 object_2.

Action clip parameters: object_0 object_1 object_2. Preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Effects add: vase object_0 object_1. Effects delete: next object_0 object_2.

Action wretched parameters: object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3. Preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: next object_0 object_1.

Action memory parameters: object_0 object_1 object_2. Preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: next object_0 object_1.

Action tightfisted parameters: object_0 object_1 object_2. Preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.

Initial facts provided: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_12 object_10; next object_3 object_7; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_8.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the human player analyst. Produce a concise, human-readable high-level plan hypothesis and identify which actions (from the public action list) look relevant to achieve the goal, and list ambiguities or missing bindings that you cannot resolve without further modelling.
analyze.prompt: Act as 'player'. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->player->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->player->goal}. Provide a high-level sequence of candidate actions, identify required object bindings and any ambiguous predicate usages or missing facts that block execution. Do not emit PDDL; keep the output as a structured human plan and questions for the modeller.

model.system_prompt: You are a deterministic simulator and model-builder. Convert each action description into an explicit action schema: list parameters, preconditions as positive literal lists, add-effects, delete-effects. Provide a concise state-transition interpretation and show sample application on the declared initial facts to demonstrate reachable updates.
model.prompt: Act as 'simulator'. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->simulator->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->simulator->goal}. Emit a machine-friendly action-schema model (JSON-style or logical schema) for each available action, enumerate predicates and arities inferred, and simulate at least one example application from the initial facts. Do not emit PDDL here; produce a formal model that the orchestrator can translate.

audit.system_prompt: You are the temporal/causal auditor. Your task is to check the model and the high-level plan for causal loops, inconsistent bookkeeping shortcuts, aggregated tokens, or implicit state assumptions. Replace any bookkeeping shortcuts with explicit predicates and constraints and normalize predicate naming and arities. Produce a corrective report and an amended action-schema set ready for planner synthesis.
audit.prompt: Act as 'auditor'. Use the inputs {analysis_player} and {model_simulator} plus your private knowledge {agents->auditor->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->auditor->goal}. Identify and remove bookkeeping shortcuts and implicit assumptions, ensure temporal ordering and causal dependencies are explicit, and return an audited model and a list of necessary corrections. Do not emit PDDL; return an audit report and an amended model representation.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that integrates other agents' outputs and must produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Keep actions of different agents distinct if applicable and use the audited, explicit model provided by the auditor. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is syntactically appropriate for FastDownwards (STRIPS-style where possible, explicit typing optional).
pddl.prompt: Act as 'orchestrator'. Use the inputs {analysis_player}, {model_simulator}, {audit_report} and the public information {environment->public_information}. Your objective is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the models and the high-level plan into a coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions clearly namespaced if you preserve distinct implementations. Enclose domain between <domain></domain> and problem between <problem></problem>. Output only the PDDL domain and problem wrapped in the specified tags.
